extracted_rules.rule: Vaulted Entryway Area Calculation for Gross Floor Area

Qualifiers.Scope: Defines the method for calculating the floor area of a specific type of entryway and its contribution to the total gross floor area of a building.
Qualifiers.Applicability: This rule applies to entryways that are classified as 'vaulted'.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: The text does not specify any exclusions. It clarifies that recessed portions of the entryway are included.

Variables.entryway_floor_area: The area of the entryway floor, measured to the outside material of the entryway feature. This includes portions recessed beyond the main house facade.
Variables.is_vaulted: A boolean or categorical state determining if an entryway is considered 'vaulted'. The specific criteria for this classification are not defined in the text. [Ambiguous Language: 'considered to be a vaulted entryway']
Variables.calculated_contribution_to_gfa: The resulting area value to be added to the gross floor area.

Constants.measurement_boundary_standard: The area is measured to the outside material of the entryway feature.
Constants.recessed_portion_procedure: A portion of the entryway recessed beyond the house facade and roof is included in the area that counts.

Conditions.trigger_condition: If the entryway is considered to be a vaulted entryway.
Conditions.mandatory_action: The entryway_floor_area must be multiplied by the area_multiplier (2) to determine its contribution to the gross floor area.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a sub-procedure within the larger calculation of 'Gross Floor Area'.
Relationships.Cross-references: Visual clarification is provided by 'Figure 7: Entry feature with gabled roof', which includes Isometric View, Side Elevation, and Porch Floor Plan diagrams.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: The application of the 'area_multiplier' is logically dependent on the 'is_vaulted' variable being true.
